intro: Anthephora hochstetteri var. tellinii, commonly known as the Hochstetter's anthephora, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
